string.text: Czarnków is a village of Kórnik Castle. Villagers have made intensive efforts to grow mulberry bushes here to raise silkworms, a lucrative product in this region.
Güstrow is a village of Preetz Castle. Villagers have made intensive efforts to grow mulberry bushes here to raise silkworms, a lucrative product in this region.
Liège is a village of Heeswijk Castle. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Augsburg is a village of Kufstein Castle. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Brandenburg is a village of Friedland Castle. Villagers have made intensive efforts to grow mulberry bushes here to raise silkworms, a lucrative product in this region.
Sinsheim is a village of Niederalfingen Castle. This village is near a rich vein of silver in the hills.
Hodonín is a village of Červený Kameň Castle. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Dunajská Streda is a village of Červený Kameň Castle. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Opava is a village of Bouzov Castle. The mines of this district supply the iron ore for many of the forges of the kingdom.
Poysdorf is a village of Bouzov Castle. This district specializes in the harvest of timber which is floated down the river and sold to nearby towns.
Leipzig is a village of Brake Castle. The mines of this district supply the iron ore for many of the forges of the kingdom.
Bremen is a village of Brake Castle. Villagers harvest the tall trees of the heights, selling the logs to nearby towns.
Gdańsk sits on the coast of the Baltic Sea, at the southern edge of Gdańsk Bay, and nearby the Vistula river.
Złotów is a village of Gdańsk. The mines of this district supply the iron ore for many of the forges of the kingdom.
Białogard is a village of Gdańsk. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Słupsk is a village of Gdańsk. Villagers here fish for tuna, sardines, bonito, and sharks.
Roermond is a village of Heeswijk Castle. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Hambourg lies on the Elbe river, which flows into the North Sea.
Pinneberg is a village of Hambourg. Villagers make their set out at dawn to catch salmon leaping over the rocks, as well as herring and cod in the sea.
Schwerin is a village of Hambourg. This village is near a rich vein of silver in the hills.
Żary is a village of Friedland Castle. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Cologne lies on the Rhine river, which flows into the North Sea.
Dortmund is a village of Cologne. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Bydgoszcz is a village of Kórnik Castle. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Enschede is a village of Cologne. The hillside soils make fine grazing for horses.
Wien stands at the easternmost extension of the Alps mountains in the Wien Basin, near the Danube river.
Nürnberg is a village of Niederalfingen Castle. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Győr is a village of Wien. The villagers set nets in the river to catch a variety of fish.
Szczecin is a village of Preetz Castle. Villagers make their set out at dawn to catch salmon leaping over the rocks, as well as herring and cod in the sea.
Baden is a village of Wien. Villagers harvest the tall trees of the heights, selling the logs to nearby towns.
Prague lies on the Vltava river in the Prague Plateau.
Strakonice is a village of Prague. This regions rich grasses have made it a good horse country.
Zwettl is a village of Prague. This regions rich grasses have made it a good horse country.
Schärding is a village of Kufstein Castle. The villagers here make most of their income from the raising of sheep.
Lubawka is a village of Prague. Villagers have made intensive efforts to grow mulberry bushes here to raise silkworms, a lucrative product in this region.
Strasbourg lies on the Rhine river, in the Upper Rhine Plain, with the upland areas of the Vosges Mountains to the west and the Black Forest to the east.
Bern is a village of Strasbourg. Villagers have made intensive efforts to grow mulberry bushes here to raise silkworms, a lucrative product in this region.
Trier is a village of Strasbourg. The low-lying lands are suited to the growing of flax.
Wałbrzych is a village of Grodno Castle. Villagers have made intensive efforts to grow mulberry bushes here to raise silkworms, a lucrative product in this region.
Chrudim is a village of Grodno Castle. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Casarejos is a village of Castillo de Magaña. The local landowners have established stud farms, supplying horses to cavalry.
Bragança is a village of Castelo de Monforte. This land is rich in wheat.
Amarante is a village of Castelo de Monforte. This land is rich in wheat.
Coruche is a village of Castelo de Évora Monte. The wines of this region are unusually sweet and strong and valued throughout the kingdom.
El Barranquete is a village of Castillo de Orihuela. Villagers trap rainwater and runoff from the hills to water their fields and their gardens of date palms.
Zamora is a village of Castillo de Villapadierna. The wines of this region are unusually sweet and strong and valued throughout the kingdom.
Valladolid is a village of Castillo de Villapadierna. The villagers here make most of their income from the raising of sheep.
Cáceres is a village of Castillo de Alange. Villagers plant olives here on the hillsides.
Illana is a village of Castillo de Arbeteta. The wines of this region are unusually sweet and strong and valued throughout the kingdom.
Molina de Aragón is a village of Castillo de Arbeteta. The mines of this district supply the iron ore for many of the forges of the kingdom.
Bujaraloz is a village of Castillo de Tiebas. This village is near a rich vein of silver in the hills.
Valencia sits on the west coast of the Mediterranean Sea, in the eastern Iberian Peninsula.
Albacete is a village of Valencia. The soil is thin in these parts, but the village does well with hogs and other livestock.
La Sénia is a village of Valencia. Villagers harvest the tall trees of the heights, selling the logs to towns on the coast.
Talarrubias is a village of Castillo de Alange. The wines of this region are unusually sweet and strong and valued throughout the kingdom.
Lisbon lies on the mouth of the Tagus river, in the western portion of the Iberian Peninsula.
Beja is a village of Castelo de Évora Monte. The wines of this region are unusually sweet and strong and valued throughout the kingdom.
Pombal is a village of Lisbon. The local landowners have established stud farms, supplying horses to cavalry.
Tomar is a village of Lisbon. This land is rich in wheat.
Penamacor is a village of Lisbon. This land is rich in wheat.

Kožnaje haspadarstva maje horad, žycharoŭ jakoha vyśmiejvajuć za pravincyjnuju biazhustasć, i dla Impieryi hetkim horadam zjaŭlajecca Sievilla. Adna z pieršych Impierskich kałonij, zasnavanych u hłybini Pierasičnaha mora, horad słužyŭ Impieryi bazaj dla pakareńnia zachodnich pałajskich plamionaŭ. Paravinaŭs z radaściu prymaŭ narabavanaje i raboŭ, jakich dasyłaŭ im harnizon, ale za śpinaju kpiŭ nad im. Usio źmianiłasia, kali džalmaryjskij hienierał Karsoŭs zładziŭ vajskovy pieravarot. Kali sienatar, źbity z tołku jaho składanym akcentam, niarvova paprasiŭ jaho paŭtaryć pastanovu, jon ahaliŭ mieč i skazaŭ: Ty razumieješ heta?
Huéscar is a village of Castillo de Orihuela. The wines of this region are unusually sweet and strong and valued throughout the kingdom.
Osuna is a village of Sevilla. The hillside soils make fine grazing for horses.
Pozoblanco is a village of Sevilla. This land is rich in wheat.
Barcelona sits on the west coast of the Mediterranean Sea, in the northeast Iberian Peninsula.
Figueres is a village of Barcelona. The region is known for its production of wheat and barley.
Tudela is a village of Castillo de Magaña. The low-lying coastline is well-suited to the construction of salt pans.
Falset is a village of Barcelona. The low-lying coastline is well-suited to the construction of salt pans.
Alfarràs is a village of Barcelona. This village is near a rich vein of silver in the hills.
Santiago sits in the northwest Iberian Peninsula, near the mountains Serra dos Ancares.
Lugo is a village of Santiago. This land is rich in wheat.
Ponferrada is a village of Santiago. The hillside soils make fine grazing for horses.
Toledo lies on the Tagus river, near the mountains Sistema Central, south of the mountains Sierra de Guadarrama, and southwest of the mountains Sierra de Gredos, in the central Iberia Peninsula.
Talayuela is a village of Toledo. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Huesca is a village of Castillo de Tiebas. The mines of this district supply the iron ore for many of the forges of the kingdom.
La Solana is a village of Toledo. This land is rich in wheat.
Ciudad Real is a village of Toledo. This land is rich in wheat.
Coimbra sits in the eastern Iberian Peninsula, east of the Atlantic Ocean.
Fundão is a village of Coimbra. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Miranda do Corvo is a village of Coimbra. This land is rich in wheat.
Alba is a village of Guillaumes Castle. This district specializes in the harvest of timber which is floated down the river and sold to nearby towns.
Brescia is a village of San Giorgio Castle. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Monselice is a village of San Giorgio Castle. Villagers have made intensive efforts to grow mulberry bushes here to raise silkworms, a lucrative product in this region.
Bitonto is a village of Massafra Castle. Villagers have made intensive efforts to grow mulberry bushes here to raise silkworms, a lucrative product in this region.
Policoro is a village of Massafra Castle. This village is near a rich vein of silver in the hills.
Livorno is a village of Bonifacio Castle. Fishermen sail out into the sea for tuna and sardines.
Grosseto is a village of Bonifacio Castle. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Cutro is a village of Lombardia Castle. Decent clay can be found in the small streams that rush down from the hills.
Zug is a village of Mesocco Castle. This village is near a rich vein of silver in the hills.
Liezen is a village of Moosham Castle. Villagers have made intensive efforts to grow mulberry bushes here to raise silkworms, a lucrative product in this region.
Felitto is a village of Alarcón Castle. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Ancona sits on the coast of the Adriatic Sea, north of the middle Apennine Mountains.
Draguignan is a village of Guillaumes Castle. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Castrovillari is a village of Ancona. The village makes its living from mining nearby salt deposits.
Fabriano is a village of Ancona. Sheep graze on the low slopes overlooking the hazy flatlands.
Agnone is a village of Ancona. Decent clay can be found in the small streams that rush down from the hills.
Venezia lies on the shallow Venetian Lagoon, surrounded by a group of islands that are separated by expanses of open water and linked by bridges.
Adrano is a village of Lombardia Castle. The village makes its living from mining nearby salt deposits.
Ferrara is a village of Venezia. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Ljubljana is a village of Venezia. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Pula is a village of Venezia. The village makes its living from mining nearby salt deposits.
Palermo sits on the coast of the Tyrrhenian Sea, in northwest Sicily island.
Canicattì is a village of Palermo. Coastal meadows, where tall grasses tolerant of the ocean salt spray thrive, support the rearing of fine horses.
Taurianova is a village of Palermo. The villagers here make most of their income from the raising of sheep.
Partanna is a village of Palermo. The villagers of this region specialize in the raising of pigs.
Roma sits in the middle of the Italian Peninsula, southwest of the middle Apennine Mountains.
Pontecorvo is a village of Roma. Sheep graze on the low slopes overlooking the hazy flatlands.
LAquila is a village of Alarcón Castle. Villagers harvest the tall trees of the heights, selling the logs to towns on the coast.
Firenze is a village of Roma. The hillside soils make fine grazing for horses.
Napoli sits on the west coast of the southern Italian peninsula.
Cerignola is a village of Napoli. Sheep graze on the low slopes overlooking the hazy flatlands.
Troia is a village of Napoli. The village makes its living from mining nearby salt deposits.
Carpino is a village of Napoli. The village makes its living from mining nearby salt deposits.
Genova sits on the coast of the Ligurian Sea, near the Apennine Mountains.
Pontremoli is a village of Genova. Decent clay can be found in the small streams that rush down from the hills.
Pavia is a village of Genova. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Vercelli is a village of Mesocco Castle. The grasses on the rolling downs are well-suited to the raising of sheep.
Cagliari sits on the coast of the Mediterranean Sea, in southern Sardinia island.
Sassari is a village of Cagliari. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Muravera is a village of Cagliari. Fishermen sail out into the sea for tuna and sardines.
Otočac is a village of Moosham Castle. The low-lying lands are suited to the growing of flax.
Hægebostad is a village of Tunsbergis Castle. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Hønefoss is a village of Mjø Castle. Villagers grow flax in the muddy valleys between the hills in this cold, rainy land.
Mullsjö is a village of Läckö Castle. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Laxå is a village of Läckö Castle. This regions rich grasses have made it a good horse country.
Finspång is a village of Stegeborg Castle. The villagers in these parts are expert trappers, hunting marten, fox, and rabbit for the rich pelts much in demand in the south.
Vimmerby is a village of Stegeborg Castle. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Karlskoga is a village of Edsholms Castle. The muddy, low-lying land here is well suited to the growing of flax.
Mora is a village of Edsholms Castle. The villagers in these parts are expert trappers, hunting marten, fox, and rabbit for the rich pelts much in demand in the south.
Lofsdalen is a village of Kongsvinger Castle. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Aalborg is a village of Kalø Castle. Villagers brave the storms that sweep through the sea to pull up ample catches of cod, char, and sometimes even small whales.
Lärbro is a village of Fardume Castle. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Bergen stands in southwestern the Scandinavian Peninsula and west of the southern part of the Scandinavian Mountains, surrounded by mountains.
Vossevangen is a village of Bergen. The villagers in these parts are expert trappers, hunting marten, fox, and rabbit for the rich pelts much in demand in the south.

Hamar is a village of Mjø Castle. Though this region is snowbound for much of the year, steppe ponies thrive on the spring grasses and in the winter dig through the snow for food, their thick coats protecting them from the icy blasts of wind.
Hyllestad is a village of Bergen. Today it is known for its daring fishermen, who venture out far to find banks, chilled by currents from the north, that are rich in cod.
Oslo lies on the arc of land at the northernmost end of the Oslofjord, in the southern Scandinavian Peninsula.
Prestestranda is a village of Oslo. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Larvik is a village of Oslo. The mines of this district supply the iron ore for many of the forges of the kingdom.
Torsby is a village of Kongsvinger Castle. Villagers net small spiny perch and crayfish in the streams, drying them for sale to travelers.
Göteborg sits on the coast of the Kattegat, an arm of the North Sea.
Trollhättan is a village of Göteborg. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Falkenberg is a village of Göteborg. Villagers brave the storms that sweep through the sea to pull up ample catches of cod, char, and sometimes even small whales.
Stockholm sits on the coast of the Baltic Sea, in the east-southern Scandinavian Peninsula.
Uppsala is a village of Stockholm. Villagers here fish for tuna, sardines, bonito, and sharks.
Visby is a village of Fardume Castle. The villagers in these parts are expert trappers, hunting marten, fox, and rabbit for the rich pelts much in demand in the south.
Södertälje is a village of Stockholm. The villagers of this region specialize in the raising of pigs.
Sandviken is a village of Stockholm. The mines of this district supply the iron ore for many of the forges of the kingdom.
Östersund sits east of the middle Scandinavian Mountains, inland the Scandinavian Peninsula.
Svenstavik is a village of Östersund. Snow-bound for much of the year, the spring grasses nonetheless sustain sizeable herds of sheep, the thick wool of which protects them from this lands icy winds.
Ljusdal is a village of Östersund. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Odense is a village of Kalø Castle. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Sundsvall sits on the coast of the Gulf of Bothnia, in the eastern Scandinavian Peninsula.
Stugun is a village of Sundsvall. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Bräcke is a village of Sundsvall. The villagers in these parts are expert trappers, hunting marten, fox, and rabbit for the rich pelts much in demand in the south.
Ånge is a village of Sundsvall. Villagers harvest the tall trees of the heights, selling the logs to nearby towns.
København sits on the eastern coast of the island of Zealand.
Lund is a village of København. Villagers brave the storms that sweep through the sea to pull up ample catches of cod, char, and sometimes even small whales.
Älmhult is a village of København. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Åmli is a village of Tunsbergis Castle. This regions rich grasses have made it a good horse country.
Zliten is a village of Bani Walid Castle. Fishermen sail out into the sea for tuna and sardines.
Oujda is a village of Gaouz Castle. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Talsint is a village of Gaouz Castle. Villagers grow dates by the coast in gardens watered by wells and small dams in the wadis that trap run-off from the cliffs during the short rainy season.
Chichaoua is a village of Essaouira Castle. The hillside soils make fine grazing for horses.
Safi is a village of Essaouira Castle. This village is near a rich vein of silver in the hills.
Skhira is a village of Younga Castle. Villagers grow dates by the coast in gardens watered by wells and small dams in the wadis that trap run-off from the cliffs during the short rainy season.
El Djem is a village of Younga Castle. Villagers grow dates by the coast in gardens watered by wells and small dams in the wadis that trap run-off from the cliffs during the short rainy season.
Tamalous is a village of Ain Darahim Castle. The seawinds bring just enough rain to support the cultivation of olive trees.
Aïn Oussera is a village of Kaoua Castle. The sides of the hills are terraced to grow wheat, with cisterns to catch the rain blowing up from the sea.
Beni Mellal is a village of Taourirt Castle. Villagers grow dates by the coast in gardens watered by wells and small dams in the wadis that trap run-off from the cliffs during the short rainy season.
Midelt is a village of Taourirt Castle. The villagers grow olives on the warm, dry landward side of the hills.
Tétouan is a village of Almahdiyya Castle. Decent clay can be found in the small streams that rush down from the hills.
Rjim Maatoug is a village of Nalut Castle. The hillside soils make fine grazing for horses.
El Oued, the name is taken from the local word for river. The town sits southwest of the Salt Lakes Chott Melrhir and Chott Felrhir, watered by an underground river.
Oum Touyour is a village of El Oued. Villagers catch a variety of fish from the salt lake.
Taibet is a village of El Oued. Villagers sink wells here to tap the groundwater, using it to irrigate their olive groves.
Zarzis is a village of Bani Walid Castle. The seawinds bring just enough rain to support the cultivation of olive trees.
Biskra is a village of El Oued. Villagers grow dates by the coast in gardens watered by wells and small dams in the wadis that trap run-off from the cliffs during the short rainy season.
Béchar sits in the northern Africa. The rocky highlands overlook the town from the east. The west, by contrast, is a flat rocky territory.
Aïn El Orak is a village of Kaoua Castle. The hillside soils make fine grazing for horses.
Bouarfa is a village of Béchar. Villagers grow dates by the coast in gardens watered by wells and small dams in the wadis that trap run-off from the cliffs during the short rainy season.
Abadla is a village of Béchar. Farmland is limited here, and the land is best known for the horses that are grazed on the deserts short-lived but rich spring grasses.
Marrakech sits in the foothills of the Atlas Mountains, in northwest Africa.
Settat is a village of Marrakech. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Azzaba is a village of Ain Darahim Castle. Coastal meadows, where tall grasses tolerant of the ocean salt spray thrive, support the rearing of fine horses.
Khouribga is a village of Marrakech. Decent clay can be found in the small streams that rush down from the hills.
Tunis sits on the south coast of the Mediterranean Sea, in North Africa.
Zaghouan is a village of Tunis. Though fishing is poor in these parts, villagers have constructed salt pans that stick far out into the shallow waters.
Siliana is a village of Tunis. Villagers grow dates by the coast in gardens watered by wells and small dams in the wadis that trap run-off from the cliffs during the short rainy season.

Sidi Slimane is a village of Almahdiyya Castle. Villagers grow dates by the coast in gardens watered by wells and small dams in the wadis that trap run-off from the cliffs during the short rainy season.
Al Huwariyah is a village of Tunis. Fishermen sail out into the sea for tuna and sardines.
Laghouat sits in the Amour Range of the Saharan Atlas, on the north edge of the Sahara Desert.
Hassi RMel is a village of Laghouat. Farmland is limited here, and the land is best known for the horses that are grazed on the deserts short-lived but rich spring grasses.
Taghit is a village of Laghouat. Farmland is limited here, and the land is best known for the horses that are grazed on the deserts short-lived but rich spring grasses.
Bou Saâda is a village of Laghouat. The low-lying lands are suited to the growing of flax.
Alger sits on the south coast of the Mediterranean Sea, in North Africa.
Tizi Ouzou is a village of Alger. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Bouïra is a village of Alger. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Thénia is a village of Alger. Fishermen sail out into the sea for tuna and sardines.
Aïn Boucif is a village of Alger. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Zagora sits in the interior of northwest Africa.
Remada is a village of Nalut Castle. Farmland is limited here, and the land is best known for the horses that are grazed on the deserts short-lived but rich spring grasses.
Taznakht is a village of Zagora. The surrounding lands, though dry, produce enough grass in the spring to allow the breeding of horses.
Tamegroute is a village of Zagora. Runoff from the hills is trapped underground here, creating springs that sustain an oasis. Wheat thrives in the fields and gardens.
Guercif is a village of Zagora. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Rabat sits on the coast of the Atlantic Ocean at the mouth of the river Bou Regreg.
Tifelt is a village of Rabat. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Benslimane is a village of Rabat. The village depends primarily on fishing, pulling black bass from the lake waters.
Ghadames, known as the pearl of the desert, sits in an oasis of North Africa.
El Borma is a village of Ghadames. Villagers grow dates by the coast in gardens watered by wells and small dams in the wadis that trap run-off from the cliffs during the short rainy season.
Sinawin is a village of Ghadames. This regions rich grasses have made it a good horse country.
Dijon is a village of Château de Sully. Villagers plant olives here on the hillsides.
Bergerac is a village of Château de Saint-Jean-dAngle. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Cholet is a village of Château de Saint-Jean-dAngle. This warm land is well-suited to the growing of olive trees.
Troyes is a village of Château de Lantilly. Villagers net small spiny perch and crayfish in the streams, drying them for sale to travelers.
Amiens is a village of Château dHardelot. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Carhaix-Plouguer is a village of Château de Quélennec. The level, wetland here is fine for the growing of flax.
Pontivy is a village of Château de Quélennec. This village is near a rich vein of silver in the hills.
Limoges is a village of Château de la Batisse. The people of this district grow flax on the marshy lands.
Brive-la-Gaillarde is a village of Château de la Batisse. Villagers trap fur-bearing animals like marten, rabbits, and foxes.
Alès is a village of Château dAumelas. Villagers plant olives here on the hillsides.
Lisieux is a village of Château des Ducs dAlençon. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Lyon lies on the confluence of the Rhône and Saône rivers, west of the Alps mountains.
Mâcon is a village of Lyon. Villagers plant flax in land reclaimed from the riverside marshes.
Pontarlier is a village of Lyon. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Carcassonne is a village of Château dAumelas. The mines of this district supply the iron ore for many of the forges of the kingdom.
Bordeaux sits on the coast of the Atlantic Ocean, near the Garonne river.
Biscarrosse is a village of Bordeaux. Villagers harvest the tall trees of the heights, selling the logs to towns on the coast.
Pau is a village of Bordeaux. Decent clay can be found in the small streams that rush down from the hills.
Agen is a village of Bordeaux. The people of this district grow flax on the marshy lands.
Caen is a village of Château des Ducs dAlençon. The wines of this region are unusually sweet and strong and valued throughout the kingdom.
Metz sits on the northeast of the Lake Madine.
Auxerre is a village of Château de Lantilly. The hillside soils make fine grazing for horses.
Verdun is a village of Metz. The villagers of this region specialize in the raising of pigs.
Bruxelles is a village of Metz. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Nancy is a village of Metz. The wines of this region are unusually sweet and strong and valued throughout the kingdom.
Nantes lies on the lower Loire river, near the Atlantic Ocean.
Alençon is a village of Nantes. The wines of this region are unusually sweet and strong and valued throughout the kingdom.
Pornic is a village of Nantes. The villagers sail out into the Atlantic Ocean in search of mullet and bass near the shore, and tuna and sardines amid the islands to the south.
Le Mans is a village of Nantes. The villagers raise sheep on brushlands that have been turned into pasture.
Orléans lies on the Loire river, in the heart of the Loire Valley.
Sens is a village of Orléans. Villagers plant olives here on the hillsides.
Chartres is a village of Orléans. This warm land is well-suited to the growing of olive trees.
Tours is a village of Orléans. This warm land is well-suited to the growing of olive trees.
Sancerre is a village of Orléans. The villagers specialize in the raising of hogs, who feast on acorns from the oak woodlands.
Marseille sits on the coast of the Gulf of Lion, part of the Mediterranean Sea, near the mouth of the Rhône river.
Grenoble is a village of Marseille. The rich grass of the down is some of the best horse-breeding land.
Valence is a village of Marseille. This warm land is well-suited to the growing of olive trees.
Paris lies on the Seine river, which flows into the English Channel, the channel links to the Atlantic Ocean and the North Sea.
Évreux is a village of Paris. The rich grass of the down is some of the best horse-breeding land.
Rouen is a village of Paris. Villagers trap fur-bearing animals like marten, rabbits, and foxes.
Reims is a village of Paris. Villagers trap fur-bearing animals like marten, rabbits, and foxes.
Toulouse lies on the Garonne River, north of the Pyrenees mountains.
Aurillac is a village of Toulouse. The mines of this district supply the iron ore for many of the forges of the kingdom.
Rocamadour is a village of Toulouse. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Castlederg is a village of Rosclogher Castle. The wines of this region are unusually sweet and strong and valued throughout the kingdom.
Pitlochry is a village of Gight Castle. The villagers were known as skilled pig farmers.
Brechin is a village of Gight Castle. The villagers of this region specialize in the raising of pigs.

Lairg is a village of Beaufort Castle. Villagers have made intensive efforts to grow mulberry bushes here to raise silkworms, a lucrative product in this region.

Al-qāhira lies on the Nile river, immediately south of the point where the river leaves its desert-bound valley and branches into the low-lying Nile Delta region.
Tanta is a village of Al-qāhira. Villagers here have laid out salt pans near where the river estuary joins the sea.
Médinet el-Fayoum is a village of Al-qāhira. Villagers trap rainwater and runoff from the hills to water their fields and their gardens of date palms.
Damiette is a village of Al-qāhira. Fishermen sail out into the sea for tuna and sardines.
Asyūt lies on the Nile river, in the middle of the Nile Valley, near the Mountains as knowns the Eastern Desert.
Ezbet Abou Saeda is a village of Asyūt. This soil, refreshed yearly by the silt of the flooding river, produces bountiful crops of wheat.
Al Wasta is a village of Asyūt. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Ras Gharib is a village of Asyūt. Fishermen sail out to sea to catch a variety of fish.

Al-iskandariyya sits on the southern coast of the Mediterranean Sea, in the far west Nile Delta area.
Damanhur is a village of Al-iskandariyya. The silt brought by the river produces bountiful crops of wheat.
Dar as Salam is a village of Al-iskandariyya. Villagers place nets and cages in the shallow edges of the lake to catch tilapia and lates.
Alruhaibat is a village of Zintan Castle. The land is best known for the horses that graze on the deserts short-lived but rich spring grasses.

Beer Sheva is a village of An-Nekhel Fortress. Barren most of the year except for scrub, it is covered in grass and flowers in the spring and is fine grazing for horses.

Al Wajh is a village of Al Mouwaylih Castle. Villagers trap rainwater and runoff from the hills to water their fields and their gardens of date palms.

Abou Douhour is a village of Halab. Rocky soil in this district limits irrigation, but horses thrive on the spring grasses of the hills.
Lattaquié is a village of Halab. Coastal meadows, where tall grasses tolerant of the ocean salt spray thrive, support the rearing of fine horses.

Ravanda is a village of Ravanda Castle. Villagers trap rainwater and runoff from the hills to water their fields and their gardens of date palms.

Mourzouq is a village of Zawilah. Barren most of the year except for scrub, it is covered in grass and flowers in the spring and is fine grazing for horses.
Al Kufrah sits in the North Africa. The region has a hot desert climate.
At Tallab is a village of Al Kufrah. The villagers here sink wells to water their groves of date palms.
Buzaymah is a village of Al Kufrah. This regions rich grasses have made it a good horse country.

Novgorod lies on the Lake Ilmen, in the East European Plain.
Valdaï is a village of Novgorod. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Velikié Louki is a village of Novgorod. The villagers trap beaver, marten, and rabbit for their pelts.
Sankt-Peterbourg is a village of Novgorod. Villagers harvest the tall trees of the heights, selling the logs to nearby towns.
Tcherepovets lies on the Sheksna river, which is a tributary of the Volga river.
Voznesenye is a village of Tcherepovets. The village depends primarily on fishing, pulling perch, bream, salmon, and occasionally large sturgeon and pike from the lake waters.
Bejetsk is a village of Tcherepovets. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Radomychl is a village of Kamianets-Podilskyi Castle. The hillside soils make fine grazing for horses.
Julivieska is a village of Hämeenlinna Castle. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Jokmok is a village of Årøybukt Castle. The low-lying lands are suited to the growing of flax.
Enontekijo is a village of Obierhs Castle. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Oviorkaliks is a village of Obierhs Castle. This regions rich grasses have made it a good horse country.
Kiruna is a village of Stekenjokk Castle. The villagers in these parts are expert trappers, hunting marten, fox, and rabbit for the pelts.
Jukkasjarvi is a village of Stekenjokk Castle. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Rovaniemi is a village of Oŭłu Castle. The low-lying lands are suited to the growing of flax.
Ranua is a village of Oŭłu Castle. The villagers in these parts are expert trappers, hunting marten, fox, and rabbit for the pelts.
Kajani is a village of Ołaŭjinlinna Castle. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Sarmijarvi is a village of Kovdar Castle. The village depends primarily on fishing, pulling perch, bream, salmon, and occasionally large sturgeon and pike from the lake waters.
Suojarvi is a village of Zamak Sehieža. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Turku sits on the coast of the Baltic Sea, in southern Fennoscandia.
Łajchija is a village of Turku . The villagers in these parts are expert trappers, hunting marten, fox, and rabbit for the pelts.
Žellivare is a village of Årøybukt Castle. This regions rich grasses have made it a good horse country.
Vantaa is a village of Turku . Villagers here fish for tuna, sardines, bonito, and sharks.
Chellefcio sits on the coast of the Gulf of Bothnia, in the northeastern Scandinavian Peninsula.
Elfśbin is a village of Chellefcio. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Liksele is a village of Chellefcio. The mines of this district supply the iron ore for many of the forges of the kingdom.
Joensu is a village of Ołaŭjinlinna Castle. The village depends primarily on fishing, pulling perch, bream, salmon, and occasionally large sturgeon and pike from the lake waters.
Chammierfest sits on the coast of the Norwegian Sea, in the northern Scandinavian Peninsula.
Kvananhsbotn is a village of Chammierfest. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Alta is a village of Chammierfest. Villagers brave the storms that sweep through the sea to pull up ample catches of cod, char, and sometimes even small whales.
Vohan sits on the coast of the Norwegian Sea, in the northwestern Scandinavian Peninsula.
Chaštad is a village of Vohan. Villagers brave the storms that sweep through the sea to pull up ample catches of cod, char, and sometimes even small whales.
Kastamukša is a village of Sehieža Castle. The villagers in these parts are expert trappers, hunting marten, fox, and rabbit for the pelts.
Narvik is a village of Vohan. The villagers of this region specialize in the raising of pigs.
Abisku is a village of Vohan. The mines of this district supply the iron ore for many of the forges of the kingdom.
Vyborh sits on the east coast of the east Gulf of Finland.
Kotka is a village of Vyborh. The villagers here make most of their income from the raising of sheep.
Savonlinna is a village of Vyborh. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Mierasłampoła is a village of Kovdar Castle. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Ivało lies on the Lake Inari, in the northern of the Scandinavian Peninsula.
Karaśjok is a village of Ivało. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Sirka is a village of Ivało. The villagers in these parts are expert trappers, hunting marten, fox, and rabbit for the pelts.
Łokka is a village of Ivało. Many of the villagers work as foresters, harvesting pine for sale to the towns.
Kirkines sits on the coast of the Barents Sea, in the northern Scandinavian Peninsula.
Nellim is a village of Kirkines. The village depends primarily on fishing, pulling perch, bream, salmon, and occasionally large sturgeon and pike from the lake waters.
Utśjoki is a village of Kirkines. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Kuopijo is a village of Hämeenlinna Castle. This regions rich grasses have made it a good horse country.
